greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Bernoulli denominators A141056(n), with the exception a(1)=1.
comment: These are also the denominators of a sequence generated by inverse binomial transform of a modified Bernoulli sequence described in (with numerators in) A176328.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4096
maple: read("transforms") ; evb := [1, 0, seq(bernoulli(n), n=2..50)] ; BINOMIALi(evb) ; apply(denom, %) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 01 2010
mathematica: a[n_] := If[OddQ[n], 2, BernoulliB[n] // Denominator]; a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 29 2012 *)
program: (PARI) A176591(n) = { my(p=1); if(n>1, fordiv(n, d, my(r=d+1); if(isprime(r), p = p*r))); return(p); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 20 2018, after code in A141056
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Apr 21 2010
